page.title: 19Uyeasound Hanseatic Booth.
page.content: The Hanseatic Booth is near the pier in the Westside of Uyeasound.4 men are doing full-time Community Council work on this building.They have 6 months to make it safe.They need to make it safe because it could fall onto someone at any minute.They are knocking it down and then rebuilding it.It will not have a roof at this time,that will perhaps come when more money is available. This booth played a big part in Unst's history.In the 16th Century, between May and August,vessels came from Germany and at the booth displayed goods for sale or barter.They had luxuries to which the islanders had no other access.To pay for these things the people caught herring which the Hansa merchants had split,dried and salted before shipment back to Germany.
